title: Sri Lanka blocks social media, arrests economic crisis protestors
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka social media was blocked overnight during a 36 hour curfew imposed ahead of protests planned for Sunday against foreign exchange crisis which had triggered power, fuel, medicine and some food shortages.

“As directed by the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL), access to Facebook, Messenger, YouTube, WhatsApp, Viber, Twitter, IMO, Instagram, Telegram, Snapchat, and TikTok is restricted with immediate effect until further notice,” the island’s largest mobile operator, Dialog Telecom said.
Social media activists had planned national protests at several locations on Sunday but authorities imposed a curfew until Monday shortly after promulgating emergency rule.
On Saturday night some activists defied the curfew to gather in protest and also broadcast social media
Police said from 2200 on April 02 to 0600 April 03, 664 curfew breakers were arrested in the Western province.
“Operations will be conducted during the curfew period to find those who break it,” police said.

Sri Lanka’s Ada Derana news in a text messages quoted the the telecom regulator as saying that several social media platforms have been blocked on the instructions of the Ministry of Defence. (Colombo/April03/2022)
